DOC.brief_summary: The aim study compare bioavailability two medication contain 100 mg minocycline capsule determine bioequivalence . They Minocycline ( Minocin® register trademark Wyeth Holdings Corporation ) , Minocycline ( Minopac® register trademark LABORATORIOS DERMATOLOGICOS DARIER , S.A. DE C.V. ) . Study design randomize , open , cross-over two single administration two period two sequence wash-out period 7 day period . Subjects study 25 healthy male volunteer , 18-55 year , Blood sample obtain 0.0 , 0.33 , 0.66 , 1.0 , 1.33 , 1.66 , 2.0 , 2.33 , 2.66 , 3.0 , 4.0 , 6.0 , 8.0 , 12.0 , 16.0 , 24.0 , 48.0 , 72.0 hour medication administration period . Plasma minocycline level determine HPLC method UV detection previously validate method . Minocycline concentration data use calculate Cmax , AUC0-t , AUC0-inf WinNonlin 5.3 software . The log transform pharmacokinetics parameter test reference medication compare calculate ratio 90 % confidence interval . Any adverse event report .
DOC.criteria: Males 1855 year . Healthy base comprehensive medical history , lab test , Chest xray , Electrocardiogram , negative test Hepatitis B C , HIV . Negative urine dope test . BMI 1926.5 kg/m2 . Lab test normal range +/ 10 % . Blood pressure 13990/8950 , heart rate 10055 , respiratory rate 2417 , temperature 37.535 °C . Nonsmoking least 10 hr study . Written informed consent . Hypersensitivity study medication relate drug . History cardiovascular , renal , hepatic , metabolic , gastrointestinal , neurologic , endocrine , hematopoietic , psychiatric organic condition . Requiring drug interfere minocycline pharmacokinetics . Exposed inducer inhibitor hepatic enzyme . Intake possible toxic drug 30 day study . Intake drug 14 day 7 halflives study . Hospitalization severe disease 60 day study . Receiving investigational drug study center 30 day study . Blood loss blood donation ≥ 450 ml 60 day study . Recent history drug abuse include alcohol . Intake xanthine containing product 10 hr study . Intake grapefruit juice hotspice 10 hr study .
